page.title: 09ST. ANDREWS CHURCH, KIRKELLA
page.content: On the day we visited St.Andrew's in Kirkella we met the vicar The Reverand Canon J.C.H. Wilson M.A. ,Hon. C.F. He had been showing a surveyor around the church. He explained to us some of the problems of trying to look after a building several hundred years old.In particular the most urgent problem was the roof that was leaking and would cost thousands of pounds to repair. He also told some of the church's history and how it had helped name the village. The original name had been Elveley, a combination of two Anglo-Saxon words : Ella meaning elf friend and Ley meaning homestead. Kirk meaning church was added in the 14th century.Kirk Elley gradually changed to Kirkella by 1700.Now there is Kirk Ella (correctly two words) and North, East, West and South Ellas.
